definition: to lean/to slant/oblique/prejudiced/to deviate from average/to stray from the intended line/stubbornly/contrary to expectations

sentences.english: We used a funnel plot to evaluate reports for publication bias.
sentences.chinese: 我们使用倒漏斗图形对出版偏倚的报道进行评价。

sentences.english: A meta-regression analysis is observational in nature and may suffer from confounding bias.
sentences.chinese: 多元回归分析是观察性的，可能存在混淆偏倚的可能。

sentences.english: Such differences exist even after controlling for differences in patient case-mix variables.
sentences.chinese: 控制病例混杂偏倚后，该差异仍然存在。

sentences.english: Cut point shift bias of self-reported health was calibrated using CHOPIT model.
sentences.chinese: 用CHOPIT模型校正自报健康的切点位移偏倚。

sentences.english: The consequences of this bias may be false-negative studies.
sentences.chinese: 研究中存在的这种偏倚可能产生假阴性结果。

definition: base (of a triangle)/base line (in geodetic survey)/horizontal

pinyin: zui4 da4 si4 ran2 gu1 ji4

definition: to proofread and correct/to edit and rectify/to correct/to calibrate
subject (in an experiment)/participant (in a clinical trial etc)
